text: U-Bahn station Schillingstraße before its 2003 renovation Platform after renovation Schillingstraße is a Berlin U-Bahn station located on the . ==History== It was built in 1930 by A. Grenander. There was a total damage in 7 May 1944, and it was repaired by 1946. The western entrance was closed in 1959, and only eastern entrance exists. In 2003 the station was renovated again and orange/red panels were attached on the walls.J. Meyer-Kronthaler: Berlins U-Bahnhöfe. be.bra Verlag (1996) ==References== Category:Berlin U-Bahn stations Category:Buildings and structures in Mitte Category:Railway stations in Germany opened in 1930
title: Schillingstraße (Berlin U-Bahn)
